data.text: Before money was invented, people followed a system of exchanging goods for goods. This system was called the barter system.
Money was first invented in Lydia in the 7<font face="GG Superscript">th</font> century Traders used pieces of gold as money.
In modern times, the government of each country prints banknotes which serve as paper money. Paper money and coins produced by the government are called currency.
In Pakistan, the State Bank controls the issue of banknotes and currency.
For safety, people keep their money in banks.
They can withdraw the money through cheques and ATMs.
Instead of money, we can also use credit cards to buy things. These are also known as plastic money.
